Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is red/brown/black in section, the interior is covered with a thick dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a letter
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.189)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36450) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36450)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 309 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
